CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 29, 1941, pg. 8, reads: "This golden - striped snake plant...sanseviera zeylaniece laurentia...blooms every seven years, in evening between 6 and 6:30. This photo was taken on March 24th, when the plant was in bloom.  The owner of this wonder plant is Mrs. W. H. Hill, 414 Sweetbriar Street, Mt. Washington.  Mrs. Hill has another snake plant which bloomed on March 23, 1933."
TitMainTitle: Blooming golden-striped snake plant in front of brick fireplace, in home of W. H. Hill, 414 Sweetbriar Street, Mt. Washington
